content.rendered:
Contact: info [@] aponte.hosting.nyu.edu.

Digital Aponte is a follow-up project to an international symposium on Aponte held at New York University from May 8-9, 2015.

The Digital Aponte Project Team includes:

  • LINDA RODRIGUEZ
    Visiting Scholar, Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies
    New York University
  • ADA FERRER
    Professor, Department of History
    New York University
  • KRIS MINHAE CHOE
    M.A. Candidate, Department of English
    New York University
  • ERIC ANDERSON
    Ph.D. Candidate, Department of History

The Annotation Team includes:

  • MATT CHILDS
    Associate Professor, Department of History
    University of South Carolina
  • ADA FERRER
    Professor, Department of History
    New York University
  • SIBYLLE FISCHER
    Associate Professor, Department of Spanish and Portuguese
    New York University
  • AGNES LUGO-ORTIZ
    Associate Professor, Department of Romance Languages and Literatures
    University of Chicago
  • STEPHAN PALMIÉ
    Professor, Department of Anthropology
    University of Chicago
  • JORGE PAVEZ-OJEDA
    Professor, Department of Sociology
    Universidad Alberto Hurtado, Chile
  • LINDA RODRIGUEZ
    Visiting Scholar, Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies
    New York University

We wish to thank the Polonsky Foundation-NYU Digital Humanities Internship Program, the Postdoctoral and Transition Program for Academic Diversity, the FAS Office of Educational Technology, and Digital Scholarship Services at Bobst Library. In particular, we would like to acknowledge Jennifer Vinopal, Zachary Coble, Andrew Battista, and Armanda Lewis for their support.
